newsitem.title: UK: Reed shares indicated lower after results.
newsitem.headline: Reed shares indicated lower after results.

text.p: Shares in Reed International Plc were indicated lower in pre-market trade on Wednesday after the Anglo-Dutch publishing group reported 1996 profits lower than most analysts had forecast.
The shares were down 13-1/2p at 11.60 stg by 0818 GMT.
Reed announced pre-tax profits of 805 million stg, up from 723 million the previous year but below analysts' forecasts which ranged from 808.0 to 821.4 million stg.
"The figures were pretty much in line with what we expected but our forecasts were at the bottom end of the range," UBS analyst Colin Tennant said.
"But the shares have had a good run and some people may have been disappointed," he said.
Reed co-chairman Nigel Stapleton told Reuters that headline earnings of the Reed-Elsevier group could be depressed by five percent if sterling's strength was maintained throughout the year.

But he noted that although sterling strength would have a negative effect on the earnings per share of Reed International, expressed in sterling, it would have a correspondingly favourable effect on the guilder EPS of Elsevier NV.
"It's good news for Elsevier and bad for Reed," Stapleton said. "(But) the two share prices are linked so much that Elsevier should pull Reed up in some respects."
